title: Proenza Schouler typeface
content:
Hello,

Can someone tell me what this logo is set in?

Thanks!!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043901/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201_102.png) | 9.11 KB |
author: tannenhauser

comments.content: Sackers is close but what Proenza is using has a bigger x height... :-/

How do you judge the x-height from a sample that is all caps?

Sackers, squooshed a bit, is the closest I can think of.  
I think I can even recognize the cut-off corners on the Z.

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043901im_/http:/typophile.com/files/z_4865.jpg)

the R's are different too. as for the Zeeeeees, proenzas Z is in gray below, Sackers in black
So you have a bigger sample? Why don’t you post that then? Makes things easier.

hey

yeah i have a bigger one :)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150218043901im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ps_3681.jpg)
Well, I would have never (ever) said Sackers, if I had seen this first. ;-)
